Package de.oth.blocklib.world.fluids.Simple

Class FluidManager

java.lang.Object
de.oth.blocklib.world.fluids.Simple.FluidManager
All Implemented Interfaces:
EventListener
public class FluidManager
extends java.lang.Object
implements EventListener
This class manages all existing instances of SimpleFluid. This manager is capable of adding as well as removing fluids.

An instance of this class is held by the main game and is updated in the game loop.

Author:
Marius Tuschl

      public void remove​(Vector3i position)
      Removes a fluid at given position.
      Parameters:
      position - Position to remove at

    • addSource

      public void addSource​(Vector3i position, short type)
      Can be used to set a source of fluid anywhere into the world.
      Parameters:
      position - the position where the fluid should be placed.
      type - the blockID of the type the fluid should have (e.g. lava).

    • setup

      public void setup()
      Should run once on startup and adds default fluids

    • add

      public void add​(Fluid fluid)
      Adds a new type of fluid. If given fluid type already exists an error message will be printed.
      Parameters:
      fluid - the fluid that should be added.

    • update

      public void update​(float deltaTime)
      Re-draws the fluid
      Parameters:
      deltaTime - time since last update

    • getPosition

      public org.lwjgl.util.vector.Vector3f getPosition()
      Description copied from interface: EventListener
      Needs to return the position of the EventListener. This is important for the EventManager to determine, if the Listener is in the range of an Event.
      Specified by:
      getPosition in interface EventListener
      Returns:
      position of the EventListener

    • notify

      public void notify​(Event e)
      Description copied from interface: EventListener
      If the EventListener registered in the EventManager, its notify method will automatically called by the EventManager, if the Listener is in range of an Event. The listener than can choose if, and how to react to the Event.
      Specified by:
      notify in interface EventListener
      Parameters:
      e - the Event that possibly affects the Listener.
